title: ARK sells $52M of Coinbase shares as COIN breaks above $270
description:
Cathie Wood’s ARK Invest continues taking profits from its Coinbase stash as the stock is hitting multi-year highs.

ARK Invest — one of 10 issuers of a spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the United States — is taking profits from its Coinbase stash amid the stock rising above $270.

On March 21, ARK sold 199,526 Coinbase (COIN) shares from its ETFs, according to a trade notification seen by Cointelegraph.

The Cathie Wood-founded investment firm dumped 133,533 COIN shares from the ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK), worth around $35 million, based on Coinbase’s closing price of $262 on March 21, according to data from TradingView.

Read more

title: Google adding Ethereum Name Service data into search results through Etherscan
description:
Tech giant Google has integrated Ethereum Name Service (ENS) data into its search results through data available from Etherscan. CryptoSlate confirmed this feature by testing it with several ENS addresses, including Vitalik.eth, an address belonging to Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of the Ethereum blockchain network. The displayed result showed the address details like the Ethereum balance […]

The post Google adding Ethereum Name Service data into search results through Etherscan appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Bybit CEO advocates for “diverse spectrum of hybrid DeFi models” during event
description: Bybit CEO Ben Zhou advocated for decentralized finance (DeFi) and interoperability between crypto and traditional finance during his Singapore keynote.

title: FTX Estate Faces $3 To $5 Billion In US Government Claims
description: Fallen cryptocurrency exchange FTX has stated that it expects the United States government to reduce its claims to between $3 billion and $5 billion.

title: MetaWin Raises the Bar for Transparency in Online Gaming
description: London, UK, March 22nd, 2024, Chainwire MetaWin, a leading platform for online prize-winning games, has introduced a groundbreaking initiative focused on enhancing transparency and fairness for players globally. After extensive research, MetaWin identified inconsistencies in Return to Player (RTP) rates among different operators, causing confusion among players.
